Name.label: Undifferentiated embryonal sarcoma of the liver
Rare tumor of liver and intrahepatic biliary tract

TextSection.Contents: Embryonal sarcoma of the liver is a rare primary malignant hepatic neoplasm of childhood of mesenchymal origin. It can rarely occur in adults. It is characterized by abdominal mass, right upper quadrant or epigastric pain, nausea, anorexia, intermittent fever or headache.
